where ( ) represents the moving average value at time ; ( + − ) is a reported number at time ( + − ); demotes the median incubation period. In addition to data from the CCDCP, updated population counts for the various geographical regions was acquired from the China Population and Development Research Center (CPDRC). The population sizes of Hubei province and Wuhan city were respectively 59.33 and 11.23 million at the end of 2019. The natural growth in the numbers of persons per day during the past 10 years were respectively 770 and 125 on average in Hubei province and Wuhan city (Tables S2, S3 ). The total population sizes at the end of 2019 and natural growth in the numbers of persons per day on average during the past 10 years are used to calculate the total population sizes every day of Hubei province and Wuhan city in 2020. The total population since 1 January of 2020 is formulated as,

In addition to the newly developed TDTR, there is a classic version [S3, S4] that can be expressed as, The calculated results based on the classic TDTR indicated that 0 ( ) increased monotonically since 24 February 2020 and asymptotically approach to 1 with COVID-19 fading out (Table S6 , Fig. S1 ).
